author: mempirate
content: Is there a way to subscribe to your beacon nodes' proposed blocks (preferably SSZ encoded) in real time? Or should you subscribe to the `heads` event stream, then call `/eth/v2/beacon/blocks/{block_id}` and then convert to JSON? Sorry if this isn't the right forum for questions like this, would be happy to ask elsewhere

author: nc1234
content: I dont think there is a stream directly publishes exactly what you describe. So yea, subscribe to `head` or `block` event stream and filter from there. I could be wrong though

author: radekkapka
content: subscribing to only your blocks is not possible

author: .paulharris
content:
you'd have to subscribe to all blocks, it wouldnt be real time but it would be once the BN gets to it, which should be fairly timely, and you'd need to filter for your proposer index manually....
So using a block subscription and filtering the data coming in would be kind of what you're asking, but not the timeliness factor...
